metadata.title: CSPAN - Israeli Ambassador to the U.N. @dannydanon: "I think that President Trump deserves a Nobel Peace Prize."
metadata.description: Israeli Ambassador to the U.N. @dannydanon: "I think that President Trump deserves a Nobel Peace Prize." https://t.co/S836y0DbOV

transcript.full_text:
Ambassador, uh, two questions to do with China Central Television. First, a US Congressman today sent a letter to nominate President Trump, Nobel Peace Prize. What is your opinion? And secondly, many leaders talking about another ceasefire, which is Gaza ceasefire. Do you think it's a good time now to talk about Gaza ceasefire? Thank you.

Well, firstly, I think that President Trump deserves a Nobel Peace Prize. I think we should thank him for for his leadership, for the brave decision he took, uh, and to recognize the effort of the United States. Regarding your second question, yes, we hope to see, uh, a ceasefire also in Gaza. There's a proposal on the table that the Ambassador Witkoff put forward and we hope to renew the negotiations on that proposal.

Mr. Ambassador, um, can you tell us what the follow-up to this ceasefire announcement is going to be? Are there going to be diplomatic, uh, talks between Iran and Israel? Is this something that Israel would like to see? The Iranians have already indicated that they want to see talks.

Well, it is after every military operation or conflict, you have the diplomatic, uh, efforts. And I I'm sure it will be the case also in this scenario. Because diplomacy failed, we had to act and the USA had to act. So I think yes, we will have to, uh, speak and negotiate, uh, and make sure that we will not repeat and get to the situation where we were 12 days ago when we had a major threat in the Middle East.

Uh, Mr. Ambassador

Well, it's too early, it's too early. You know, we just, uh, announced about the ceasefire today, but I believe it will happen soon.

Mr. Ambassador, you're talking about

Thank you so much. Thank you. I'm from RIA Novosti. Uh, would you support the Security Council, uh, having a resolution on the ceasefire between Israel and Iran? And would you maybe discuss it with your Iranian counterpart in person?

So I I don't have any communication with any representative at the UN. I don't think that we need a Security Council resolution. The parties accepted the proposal of President Trump. But, uh, maybe in the future there will be a place for involvement of the UN organization.

Ambassador, Ambassador, Ambassador,  Hamas said that it removed most of its highly enriched uranium before the strike, before hours. Israel knows where it is. And President Trump said the program was being dismantled. Does Israel agree with that? What's your assessment?

Well, I think it's it's still early to to assess, uh, all the strikes. We know we were able to push back, uh, the program. We were able to remove the imminent threat that we had. And Prime Minister Netanyahu spoke about the UN, you mentioned that we think we have an knowledge about it, but we cannot go into details about it.

Mr. Ambassador,

analysis.summary: The transcript covers a press briefing where the ambassador discusses several key issues.  First, the ambassador supports a US Congressman's nomination of President Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, praising the president's leadership.  Second, regarding the Gaza ceasefire, the ambassador expresses hope for a renewed negotiation based on an existing proposal, anticipating diplomatic efforts between Iran and Israel following any military operation.  The ambassador clarifies that the recent military action was necessary due to diplomatic failures and that further details regarding the ceasefire are premature.  Finally, regarding Hamas's claims and President Trump's statement about the dismantling of a weapons program, the ambassador confirms that Israel successfully neutralized the threat but refrains from providing specifics due to security concerns.  The UN's potential future involvement is also discussed.

key_points.text: A US Congressman nominated President Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize.
The ambassador believes President Trump deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for his leadership and brave decisions.
Discussions are underway for a ceasefire in Gaza, with a proposal put forward by Ambassador Witkoff.
The ambassador expects diplomatic talks between Iran and Israel to follow the ceasefire announcement.
The ambassador explains that diplomacy failed, necessitating military action by the USA.
The ambassador states that it's too early to discuss specific details of the ceasefire follow-up.
A reporter from RIA Novosti asks about a UN Security Council resolution on the ceasefire and potential discussions with Iranian counterparts.
The ambassador doesn't believe a Security Council resolution is necessary, as the parties accepted President Trump's proposal but leaves open the possibility of UN involvement in the future.
Hamas claimed to have removed most of its highly enriched uranium before the strike, and President Trump stated the program was being dismantled.
Israel's assessment is that it is too early to assess all the strikes but that they were able to push back the program and remove the imminent threat.
The Israeli Prime Minister spoke about the UN's knowledge of the situation, although details cannot be disclosed.
